alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 08 at 10:17AM CST until February 11 at 1:30PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam affecting Washington, Choctaw and Clarke Counties. For the Tombigbee River...including Coffeeville Dam, Leroy...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam. * WHEN...Until Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Pastureland becomes flooded. Livestock should be moved to higher ground. Old Ferry Road near the river begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 32.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CST Wednesday was 33.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to gradually to fall below flood stage by Saturday morning. It is then forecast to continue falling to 26.7 feet by Monday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued when updates occur.
